# ** _ Step 5 _ **
## Git Ignore
Sometimes there are certain files or directories that do not need to be fixed, for example, a local development configuration.
To ignore these files, you must create a * .gitignore * file in the root of the repository.

* .Gitignore * file that allows you to define patterns for files that you want to ignore, for example, * .tmp will ignore all files with the extension .tmp.

[! NOTE]
> \
Any files matching a specific template will not be displayed in the git status output and will be ignored when trying to execute the git add command.


#A task
Add and commit the * .gitignore * file to the repository to ignore all * .tmp files.
